intro: Calendula arvensis, commonly known as field marigold, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow to orange flowers, which bloom from late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has alternate, hairy leaves that are lance-shaped or ovate. Its flowering period coincides with the calendar months of September to November, hence its common name. Calendula arvensis is often found in disturbed soils, roadsides, and meadows, and is known for its medicinal properties.
